content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Sure, here is a Julia function that does exactly what you asked for:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    return filter(x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1]), words)
end
```
This function uses the built-in `filter` function to iterate over each word in the provided list (`words`). The `filter` function applies a condition (the anonymous function `x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1])`) to each element of the collection. If the condition is true, the element is kept; otherwise, it's discarded.

In this case, the condition checks whether the first character of each word (`x[1]`) matches its uppercase version (`uppercase(x[1])`). This will only be true for words that start with a capital letter (since `uppercase` returns the same string but all lowercase characters are converted to uppercase).
